message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about improving named entity recognition (NER) for Chinese social media by using word segmentation representation learning. The paper uses neural models to learn representations for predicting word boundaries, which is a common technique in natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also uses LSTM-CRF models, which are a type of neural network commonly used in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper involves information retrieval (cs.IR) and named entity recognition (cs.NE), which are both subfields of NLP. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, and cs.NE.
